intro: Argyrophanes behrii, commonly known as the silver-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a central yellow disk. Argyrophanes behrii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
